item.title: A nice comprehensive post explaining why State of the Map Conferences #SotM are so important to #OpenStreetMap: https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2023/07/07/why-state-of-the-map-conferences-are-so-important-to-osm/ Already attended one? Cc: @openstreetmap

For this #OpenStreetMap Belgium‚Äôs Mapper of the Month #MotM entry, the spotlight is on Michel Hebert from #Grenoble, France: https://openstreetmap.be/en/motm/2023/07/01/michel-hebert.html. He will probably be known by the people following @OsmGrenoble. Cc: @openstreetmap

OSM Relatify is a new web tool designed to simplify the process of editing public transport relations in #OpenStreetMap. A key feature is the smart routing logic to automatically construct bus routes from given bus stops and ways, taking into account factors like one-way streets and roundabouts. https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/NorthCrab/diary/401755 #OSMRelatify Screenshot of OSM Relatify, a tool to simplify editing public transport relations within OpenStreetMap

This month, the #OpenStreetMap Belgium‚Äôs Mapper of the Month #MotM is @zverik (Ilya), probably already known to you for his #Everydoor or #OSMCards projects (and a lot more, of course): https://openstreetmap.be/en/motm/2023/06/01/zverev.html.
What Android app would you recommend to convert geo coordinates in different formats? Ideally, Free software. #geocaching #FOSS #Android
Is there a public web tool to a draw circle on an #OpenStreetMap map to measure the straight-line distance between places?
The #OpenStreetMap Belgium series of Mapper of the Month #MotM interviews is home again with Jean-Louis Stanus: https://openstreetmap.be/en/motm/2023/05/01/jeanlouis-stanus.html.
A nice and comprehensive #OpenStreetMap How-To on ‚ÄúMapping a turbo roundabout with #JOSM‚Äù: https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/Peter%20Elderson/diary/401459.

#OpenStreetMap mapper ivanbranco shares his list of favourite OSM-related tools/websites/apps: https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/ivanbranco/diary/401437. There are certainly some you‚Äôll discover or rediscover.

A nice collection of free resources to learn #GIS (geographic information system) with #MOOC, self-guided learning, university courses, and more. https://www.gislounge.com/learn-gis-for-free/ #GISLounge

DIY Wi-Fi sensor, no programming, no soldering required. This project combines two ideas: no-code/low-code software platform and a quick, robust prototyping system that requires no soldering. https://galopago.github.io/english/wifi-sensor-nocode-nosoldering/ #Arduino #IoT #DIY #ESP32 #DS18B20 #I2C #ESPHome #Misistemita
TrickyFoxy mapper explains ‚ÄúWhy you should try Every Door‚Äù to contribute to #OpenStreetMap: https://telegra.ph/Why-you-should-try-Every-Door-01-02 #EveryDoor (Edit: fix link)

Introducing the #Communities tab on #OpenStreetMap.org website. In the upper right corner of OSM.org, you can now see a ‚ÄúCommunities‚Äù tab that links to a single, centralized location that lists formal Local Chapters, as well as the other OSM communities. https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2022/12/30/introducing-the-communities-tab-on-osm-org/

The #MapperDiaries channel on YT has an on-the-field video demo of #StreetComplete, so if you wondered what it takes in practice to contribute to #OpenStreetMap with it, you can see the live action. https://yewtu.be/watch?v=kjciqzv3Mwg

Searching for new people and content to follow? #Followgraph for Mastodon allows you to expand your network and find new people to follow. It works by looking up your "follows' follows". https://followgraph.vercel.app/

Nice article on how #OpenStreetMap editors efforts in #Australia have contributed a comprehensive dataset on sealed and unsealed road surfaces in New South Wales: https://little-maps.com/2022/12/16/openstreetmap-now-has-comprehensive-data-on-sealed-and-unsealed-roads-across-new-south-wales-australia/

To find a #Mastodon instance that is geographically close to your interests, there is ‚ÄúMastodon Near Me‚Äù, showing a curated selection of servers open for registration and serving specific countries, regions or cities. https://umap.openstreetmap.fr/en/map/mastodon-near-me_828094#5/46.241/9.976 #Mastotips (Via #WeeklyOSM: https://weeklyosm.eu/archives/16111)

Interesting #OpenStreetMap diary by contributor Graptemys detailing their process to cleaning up cuisine tags in Canada with #JOSM to improve data quality and consistency. https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/Graptemys/diary/400295 (Via #WeeklyOSM: https://weeklyosm.eu/archives/16111)

I never imagined when joining 4 years ago I‚Äôd be privileged to #celebrate üéâ 400 üíØüíØüíØüíØfollowers interested in reading my OpenStreetMap and other Open Source matters. The recent mass arrival of users in the fediverse was very visible, but numbers are nothing without quality, and a good news is qualitative content is there with a lot of great stuff appearing all over the place.

The #OpenStreetMap Belgium Mapper of the Month #MotM series flies to USA to let us meet Patricia Solis known for her involvement in #YouthMappers: https://openstreetmap.be/en/motm/2022/11/01/patricia-solis.html
